# two examples: one manually and one from Innan's article (with corrected mistake)
align004.fas Innan
    Piw: 2.6 2.2
    Pib: 3.4
::

    Piw: 1.6 3.4 2.4
    Pib: 2.9 2.8 2.8
::

    num_tot: 3
    num_pop: 3 3 3
    num_pair: 3 3 3
::

    num_tot: 5
    num_pop: 5 5 5
    num_pair: 5 5 5

    num_tot: 7

    num_pair: 7 7 7

    num_tot: 10
    num_pop: 10 8 9
    num_pair: 8 10 8

    ns: 5
    ls: 56
    lseff: 43
    nseff: 5
    S: 10
    eta: 10

    ls: 56

    nseff: 4.9
    S: 14
    eta: 16

# using R package rehh (Gautier and Vitalis) with their own example file
# for iES it is necessary to use option crop_EHHS because rehh sets all EHHS<threshold to 0 and EggLib does not do it by default
bta12_cgu EHH core=456,chr=12,thr=0.05,thrS=0.05,left=10,right=10,EHH_crop=True

# Ad hoc test file
triconfig.fas Align haplotypes=False,max_missing=1,lvl_pop=0,multiple=True,triconfig_min=2
    S: 42
    triconfig: 4 2 3 4 2 3 3 2 5 4 2 1 4
::

triconfig.fas Align haplotypes=False,max_missing=1,lvl_pop=0,multiple=True,triconfig_min=4
    S: 42
    triconfig: 2 1 3 1 1 3 2 2 3 4 1 1 2
::
